cho_description:
تخت جمشید، سنگ نگاره پلکان شمالی کاخ آپادانا  

Central Relief of the North Stairs of the Apadana, Persepolis, The 5th century BC. 

The reliefs showed the enthroned Persian king Darius in the centre, while towards him moved processions of tribute bearers representing twenty-three different subject peoples.

Persepolis was destroyed by Alexander the Great in 330 BC.

This model was made with 23 photos captured by a simple compact camera with low resolution.

Made by Ginza Fahimi:

https://sketchfab.com/ginza
cho_title: Relief of North Stairs of Apadana, Persepolis
